content.description: This climb starts just left of the tight gully or large chimney. Look for a diagonal finger sized crack going up and left. Follow this until it peters out under a small roof with a one foot tall crack under it. Move up through the roof. There is a nice vertical crack right above the roof. Continue straight up ending at a pair of pine trees on top.
content.location: Route starts about 100 yards north of Woody. Look for a large flake with a small tight gully or large chimney behind it. The base is on a wide ledge 20 feet up a rock band. It is before reaching the landmark very large pine tree.

content.description: Climb face up to a horizontal crack. Move left and up a vertical flake. Keep left toward the outside corner and continue to top.
content.location: Route starts about 500 feet North of Woody. Look for a break and gully and then a very large pine tree. Climb starts and is belayed from on a wide ledge 20 feet up above and right of this tree.
